intro: Brodiaea luzula, commonly known as the Luzula brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its grass-like foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it blooms in the spring. Brodiaea luzula is often found in alpine or subalpine regions, where it thrives in cooler, moist environments.
